info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 5 at 1:26PM EDT until August 5 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh NC
info.description:
FFWRAH
The National Weather Service in Raleigh has extended the
* Flash Flood Warning for... Stanly County in central North Carolina...
* Until 315 PM EDT.
* At 126 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Albemarle, Badin Lake, Plyler, Locust, Norwood, Badin, Oakboro, Stanfield, Richfield, New London, Finger, Lake Tillery and Morrow Mountain State Park.
This includes the following frequently flooded locations... Town Creek between Main St and Snuggs Rd, Memory Creek at Main St, Town Creek at Bethany Rd, Little Long Creek at Old Charlotte Rd., Long Creek at Kingsley Dr. and W. Main St, Melchor Branch at Ridge St., and Coley Branch at Corbin St.
And the following flood prone locations... Long Creek at Poplin Rd, Big Bear Creek at Bridgeport Rd and Boogar Hollar rd, Mountain Creek at Mountain Creek Rd, Curl Tail Creek at Gold Branch Rd and Big Bear Creek at Old Mill Rd.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don't drown. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
